citation.article-title: Eight new species of the genus Micromonospora, Micromonospora citrea sp. nov., Micromonospora echinaurantiaca sp. nov., Micromonospora echinofusca sp. nov. Micromonospora fulviviridis sp. nov., Micromonospora inyonensis sp. nov., Micromonospora peucetia sp. nov., Micromonospora sagamiensis sp. nov., and Micromonospora viridifaciens sp. nov.

p.s: (ci’tre.a. L. fem. adj. citrea of wood from citrus tree)

Color of substrate mycelium is pastel orange (RAL 2003) on media ISP 2, salmon pink (RAL 3022) on ISP 3, pastel yellow (RAL 1034) on ISP 4, yellow orange on ISP 6, on ISP 5 and 7 only sparse growth with colorless mycelium occurs.
A yellow orange (RAL 2000) soluble pigment is formed on medium ISP 6.
Carbohydrate utilization pattern is indicated in Table 2.
Positive (APIZym) for esterase (C4), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, chymotrypsin, naphtol-AS-Bi-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, and N-acetyl-β-glucoseamidase.

Positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C8), phosphatase acid and α-glucosidase activities; negative for lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucoronidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
Peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimelic acid; diagnostic sugars are xylose and glucose; MK-9 (H4) is the principal menaquinone; diagnostic phospholipid is phosphatidylethanolamine.
The fatty acids are given in Table 3.
16S rRNA gene accession number is X92617.
Type strain DSM 43903T, JCM 3256T, ATCC 35571T, IFO 14025T, NRRL B-16101T.
